thread.title: Walker's sons were paid $1,500 a month on campaign trail
thread.title_full: Walker's sons were paid $1,500 a month on campaign trail

title: Walker's sons were paid $1,500 a month on campaign trail
text:
Walker's sons were paid $1,500 a month on campaign trail Published On: Oct 15 2015 04:38:39 PM CDT Updated On: Oct 15 2015 09:04:29 PM CDT Tweet MADISON, Wis. - 
Gov. Scott Walker's two college-aged sons were paid about $1,500 a month to campaign for their dad during his brief run for president. Related Content Steineke says no changes coming to civil service bill 
Walker's campaign finance report filed Thursday with the Federal Election Commission shows that both Matt and Alex were paid roughly $1,500 a month by the campaign. 
The report shows Alex Walker was paid $4,819 between June 30 and September and Matt Walker was paid $4,824. 
Walker spokesman Tom Evenson says Matt and Alex had part-time jobs at campaign headquarters and returned to school when the fall semester started. 
Both sons were frequently by Walker's side before he abruptly dropped out of the race on Sept. 21. 
Copyright 2015 The Associated Press.
